CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG of Kharkiv ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) , upon the applicant ’s claim , ordered ORG in GPE District of GPE ( GPE районне відділення ORG у PERSON , hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) to recalculate in GPE hryvnas the applicant ’s salary , which he received in DATE in NORP roubles , in order to establish the correct amount of his pension according to LAW DATE ( hereinafter “ the Decree ” ) . The defendant was also obliged to pay the applicant the recalculated amount as his regular pension .
CARDINAL . This judgment became final on DATE and the writ of execution was issued on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE of ORG ( hereinafter “ the Bailiffs ” ) issued the warrant for the enforcement of the judgment by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Bailiffs re - issued the warrant .

CARDINAL . As ORG twice submitted calculations of the applicant ’s pension which were not based on the Decree , on DATE and CARDINAL DATE the Bailiffs fined the officials of ORG for failure to enforce the judgment .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant and the Bailiffs requested ORG of the Dzerzhinsky District of Kharkiv ( hereinafter “ the Public Prosecutor ” ) to institute criminal proceedings against the officials of ORG for intentional non - enforcement of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected this request for want of proof of a crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint against this decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request , ORG issued a ruling explaining the judgment of DATE . It indicated the coefficients that should be used by ORG in order to recalculate the applicant ’s pension according to the Decree .
CARDINAL . ORG did not appeal against this ruling within the statutory time - limit and the same court , by rulings of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , returned ORG belated appeal without considering it .
CARDINAL . During DATE , following numerous written requests by the Bailiffs , ORG submitted recalculations of the applicant ’s pension , which were not based on the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff personally handed to the official of ORG the ruling of DATE and requested him to enforce it by CARDINAL DATE . The bailiff drew up a written report .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , on behalf of ORG , lodged with ORG a cassation appeal against the rulings of DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following the request of ORG , the Bailiffs suspended the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Head of the Bailiffs quashed this decision on the ground that lodging a cassation appeal in itself could not suspend the enforcement of the final judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the Bailiffs fined the officials of ORG for failure to enforce the judgment of DATE and the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Bailiffs requested ORG to institute criminal proceedings against the officials of ORG for intentional non - enforcement of the judgment of DATE and ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected this request for want of proof of a crime .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG rejected ORG cassation appeal against the rulings of DATE and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected ORG request to review the case in the light of newly disclosed circumstances and to suspend the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( hereinafter “ the Court of Appeal ” ) upheld this ruling .
CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE remains unenforced .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant for threatening a judge of ORG ( Article CARDINAL of LAW ) . The applicant was obliged not to leave his place of his permanent residence .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon termination of the pre - trial investigation , ORG transmitted the criminal case to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following the motion of the President of ORG , transferred the case to ORG of Kharkiv ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint against ORG decision of DATE as the case was pending before the first instance court .

CARDINAL . In the course of its examination of the applicant ’s appeal against the ruling of DATE , ORG established that the applicant had not been not duly informed about the date of hearing before ORG and on DATE requested ORG to investigate this matter .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the ruling of DATE . On DATE , it issued a ruling to the ORG setting out procedural omissions by the judge of ORG who had examined the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s cassation appeal against the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the criminal proceedings against the applicant as time - barred .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal seeking to be acquitted .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . In DATE the proceedings were resumed before ORG .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE CARDINAL out of CARDINAL hearings scheduled were adjourned due to the ORG and the victim ’s failure to appear before the court .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the case was assigned to another judge .
CARDINAL . The proceedings are still pending before the first instance court .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law concerning the non - enforcement of the final judgments is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
